medical_history.chief_complaint: Complex partial seizures that had become generalized.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported that his seizures began at age 15 after being struck on the right side of the head, with a loss of consciousness. Symptoms included an aura of warmth on the right side of the head and occasional myoclonic jerks before losing awareness. Seizures occurred as often as six times a week, typically two to three times each week, with tongue biting and incontinence. He experienced generalized fatigue, malaise, and severe headaches in the two weeks prior to presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of seizures starting at age 15, with prior evaluation showing a focal area of dense calcification in the left hippocampus. He was treated with phenytoin and carbamazepine.
medical_history.family_history: There was no family history of seizures or other neurologic disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was unmarried and unemployed due to his symptoms, residing with his brother. He did not have a history of tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drug use.
